Biology_26_r$Biology_tweet_55_p$Biology_.text:
Finding A: The vlincRNAs were shown to be present in cancerous cells as well as stem cells and normal human tissues.
Finding B: Bifidobacteria were found to be established (High-Bif qPCR ) earlier in secretorfed infants (60% of infants versus 37.5% at day 6) and more often (80% versus 50% by day 120) ( Figure 5 ).
Finding C: Rather, we suggest that cheetah chases comprise two primary phases: (i) an initial rapid acceleration resulting in high speed to quickly catch up with prey, followed by (ii) a prey-specific slowing period that enables the cheetah to match turns instigated by prey as the distance between them closes.
Finding D: Our hands on biology education kits are out @username! A fun and special collaboration between scientists and K-12 students and teachers. #synbio #STEMeducation #scienceoutreach @username @username

Biology_216_r$Biology_222_p$Biology_415_.text:
Finding A: They found that increasing the wood harvest to the equivalent of 34 percent or more of annual wood growth would have profound and positive effects: Between 14 percent and 31 percent of global CO2 emissions could be avoided by preventing emissions related to steel and concrete; by storing CO2 in the cellulose and lignin of wood products; and other factors.
Finding B: In addition, native plants may have the capacity to out-compete or coexist with the invaders, at least in some local environments .
Finding C: With whey pre-load, insulin and GLP-1 responses also were significantly higher (105 and 141 percent, respectively), producing a 96 percent increase in early insulin response.
Finding D: These data show that C3 is required for maximal inflammation and bone loss in P. gingivalis-induced periodontitis in mice.

Finding B: In addition, native plants may have the capacity to out-compete or coexist with the invaders, at least in some local environments .

Biology_71_r$Biology_423_r$Biology_438_r.text:
Finding A: The BioBits kits enable us to expose young kids, older kids, and even adults to the wonders of synthetic biology and, as a result, are poised to transform science education and society.
Finding B: All these relations together form a robust network of interactions between plants and pollinators.
Finding C: The fact that the Western corn rootworm is able to perceive iron complexes and to adjust its dietary behavior accordingly is also relevant for the understanding of food chains.
Finding D: Increases in infectiousness as the fungus grows on hibernating bats may drive winter transmission, with loads increasing throughout the winter.

Finding A: Teijaro and colleagues found that the ABHD12-knockout mice, as well as the mice treated with the ABHD12 inhibitor, had immune responses that were much more vigorous and effective in clearing the virus, often excessively so.
Finding B: Messenger et al. show that exosome secretion in cancer cells is Ca2+-stimulated and dependent on Ca2+-bound Munc13-4. Munc13-4, a late endosome priming factor, acts via a Rab11-dependent pathway to prepare multivesicular endosomes for exocytosis
Finding C: To address this, we depleted the γ -TuRC from Xenopus extracts and induced MT nucleation by RanQ69L, whereas XMAP215 and proteins that are required for branching MT nucleation were not depleted ( Supplementary Fig.
Finding D: Study: Whey protein may have a role in reducing postprandial blood glucose levels in diabetes patients.

Biology_tweet_25_p$Biology_417_p$Biology.text:
Finding A: This study leverages from a unique and well-characterized cohort including participants with NAFLD-cirrhosis which allows studying the specific gutmicrobiome signature of this extreme and well-defined clinical phenotype.
Finding B: While we demonstrate that amphibian communities are sensitive to changes in climate, our results suggest that changing climate is not the proximate cause for ongoing assemblage-wide declines that have been observed in North American amphibians.
Finding C: We present evidence for extensive negative selection over somatic point mutations in cancer exomes.
Finding D: We anticipate that the availability of our BioBits™ kits and the data reported here will encourage teaching and broaden participation in the field of synthetic biology.
Biology_tweet_25_p$Biology_417_p$Biology.displayed_text:
Finding A: This study leverages from a unique and well-characterized cohort including participants with NAFLD-cirrhosis which allows studying the specific gutmicrobiome signature of this extreme and well-defined clinical phenotype.
Finding B: While we demonstrate that amphibian communities are sensitive to changes in climate, our results suggest that changing climate is not the proximate cause for ongoing assemblage-wide declines that have been observed in North American amphibians.
Finding C: We present evidence for extensive negative selection over somatic point mutations in cancer exomes.
Finding D: We anticipate that the availability of our BioBits™ kits and the data reported here will encourage teaching and broaden participation in the field of synthetic biology.

Finding B: It shows you can produce profound changes in the brain with training.
